definitions.definition: In a firm or secure manner , securely ; in such a way as not to be moved; safe , sound [from 10th c.] .
examples: Hold this rope as fast as you can.
The princess was sleeping fast , and her servants were fast asleep too.

definitions.definition: Immediately following in place or time; close , very near [from 13th c.] .
examples: The horsemen came fast on our heels.
Fast by the sturdy batsman the ball unheeded sped. / That ain't my style, said Casey. Strike one, the umpire said.

definitions.definition: Quickly , with great speed ; within a short time [from 13th c.] .
examples: Do it as fast as you can.

definitions.definition: Ahead of the correct time or schedule .
examples: I think my watch is running fast .

main_definition: In a firm or secure manner , securely ; in such a way as not to be moved; safe , sound [from 10th c.] .
secondary_definitions: ( of sleeping ) Deeply or soundly [from 13th c.] .
Immediately following in place or time; close , very near [from 13th c.] .
Quickly , with great speed ; within a short time [from 13th c.] .
Ahead of the correct time or schedule .
